item.title: From AI-Generated to Production-Ready Code: WebStorm Refactorings for the Modern Workflow
item.description: We‚Äôve all been there. You ask your AI tool to generate a React component, and the initial result works perfectly in the beginning. The AI gives you a functional 250-line component that gets the job done quickly and is exactly what you need for rapid prototyping. But even though AI does indeed excel at generating [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/webstorm/2025/09/from-ai-generated-to-production-ready-code-webstorm-refactorings-for-the-modern-workflow/

item.title: Supercharging Unit Test Generation with in-IDE TestSpark
item.description: Test generation is an essential yet time-consuming part of quality assurance. Automating test-generation techniques means accelerating the development process and improving the quality of the final software. However, traditional automated techniques, and their respective tools, are not usually user-friendly, having a command-line interface and not being integrated with the IDE. To boost acceleration and quality [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/research/2025/09/testspark-unit-test-generation/

item.title: Islands Theme: The New Look Coming to JetBrains IDEs
item.description: Starting with version 2025.2.3, JetBrains IDEs will offer a new look: the Islands theme, available in both dark and light modes. This update is a visual refresh, which means that all functionality will remain the same. The new theme can be turned on or off in the Appearance settings. This step brings us closer to [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2025/09/islands-theme-the-new-look-coming-to-jetbrains-ides/

item.description: Compose Multiplatform for web, powered by Wasm, is now in Beta! item.title: 8 Common DevOps Problems And How to Solve Them With GoLand

item.title: Spring Debugger: ApplicationContext at Your Fingertips
item.description: IntelliJ IDEA has great support for debugging Java and Kotlin applications. But if you are building Spring Boot applications, you may want to access Spring components along with their metadata. That‚Äôs where the Spring Debugger plugin comes in. It makes life easier by letting you explore and use the entire Spring ApplicationContext right from your [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/09/spring-debugger-applicationcontext-at-your-fingertips/

item.title: A Farewell to Consoles
item.description: Starting from the 2025.3 release, DataGrip and other JetBrains IDEs with database support will stop using the term query console. From now on, we‚Äôll use query file ‚Äì because consoles were essentially files all along, and it‚Äôs time the UI reflected that. We‚Äôve made the workflow simpler, more discoverable, and more consistent. A bit of [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/datagrip/2025/09/16/a-farewell-to-consoles/

item.title: FAQ: New AI Quotas
item.description: We hear you. And you‚Äôre right ‚Äì the new quotas are a reduction from what you experienced. When we launched, we had little usage data for agentic experiences and no top‚Äëup feature existed, so we set quotas much higher than the real cost of AI usage (tokens from providers) as a temporary measure. That felt [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/09/faq-new-ai-quota/

item.title: Java 25 LTS and IntelliJ IDEA
item.description: The Java release cadence means we get a new Java version every six months. Java 25 was released on September 16, 2025. At JetBrains, we are committed to supporting new technologies in IntelliJ IDEA and adding useful enhancements for both stable and preview features. In this blog post, we will give you an overview of [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/09/java-25-lts-and-intellij-idea/
